result.reason: Full screen resolution is understated because ResolutionScalingFactor uses InterfaceControl.DeviceDpi which may return 96 (default) before the control is fully laid out, causing screen.Bounds logical pixels to be used without DPI scaling.
result.approach: In SetResolution(), for Fullscreen case, obtain DPI from Screen directly (e.g. Graphics.FromHwnd) instead of relying on InterfaceControl.DeviceDpi which may not yet reflect the actual monitor DPI at connection time.

attempts.raw_output:
Based on my analysis of the code, particularly `SetResolution()` in `RdpProtocol.cs` (lines 1045-1173), the fullscreen resolution is set via `screen.Bounds.Width * ResolutionScalingFactor` â€” the DPI scaling factor may not be applied correctly at connection time (before the control is fully laid out), causing understated resolution.
